event.title: covers an administrative area of 14,679.88 km2 (5,667.93 sq mi) and according to the 2010

data.event: Hegang covers an administrative area of 14,679.88 km2 (5,667.93 sq mi) and according to the 2010 Census, has a population of 1,058,665 inhabitants.
In 1914, coalfield was discovered in Haoli, and Heilongjiang Government approved to set up Xinghua Mines (興華煤礦) which is jointly invested by merchants including Shen Songnian (沈松年).
The Hegang mines were founded in 1916 by a Chinese entrepreneur with Russian capital.
In 1926 a railway was built between Hegang and Jiamusi, some 30 miles to the south on the Songhua River.
A coal carrier fleet was privately financed in 1930 by General Zhang Xueliang.
On August 1932, Hegang mines were occupied by the Japanese as the Japanese Empire advanced through Manchuria.
On August 11, 1945, Hegang was occupied by the Soviet Red Army, and was relegated to the Communist Force.
Hegang was renamed in 1949, and set up as a prefecture-level city in Heilongjiang.
